title: Force on piston in sealed tube

content.question: A piston of mass <math alttext="m" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and cross-sectional area <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is held in place within a sealed tube, forming a chamber to the left of the piston with volume <math alttext="V sub 0 " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and a chamber to the right with volume <math alttext="4 V sub 0 " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, as shown. The chamber on the left contains <math alttext="n" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> moles of an ideal gas at temperature <math alttext="T sub 0 " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, while the chamber on the right contains <math alttext="5 n " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5</mn><mi>n</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> moles of an ideal gas at temperature <math alttext="the fraction T sub 0 over 2 " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>/</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. The piston is then released and moves with negligible friction along the length of the cylinder. Which of the following claims is correct about the direction in which the piston will initially accelerate?

choices.label: To the left, because initially the volume on the right is larger than the volume on the left.
To the left, because initially the temperature on the left is higher than the temperature on the right.
To the right, because initially the number of moles on the left is larger than the number of moles on the right.
To the right, because initially the pressure on the left is higher than the pressure on the right.

content.answer: To the right, because initially the pressure on the left is higher than the pressure on the right.
